GI killing of schoolgirls criticized in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Council of Representatives of Teachers' College students reportedly released an appeal on Dec. 29, denouncing the GIs' killing of schoolgirls.
 In the appeal the organization said the death of the two schoolgirls proved that Koreans have been deprived of independence and sovereignty by the U.S. It noted that they were awakened by the continued struggle of civic and public organizations and students and anti-U.S. resistance in front of the U.S. embassy that informed the world of the people's wrath.    
 The organization called on all students to unite to fight until the shackling South Korea-U.S. Status of Forces Agreement is revised overall and they get an open apology of arrogant Bush.
